title: Buying a skin without owning the champion
body: Is there any valid reason that you can't buy a skin for a champion you do not own? I understand that it might 'motivate' users to pay RP for champs that they don't own during sale time, but it seems mildly unfair; If I already converted a set sum of money into a microtransaction currency I should be able to use that currency in the manner that I desire.

replies.body: From a business standpoint I get it but yeah I feel the same way, knowing I'll inevitably buy every champ means I'd like access to legacy skins when available. I could always drop the RP for the champ but prefer to use IP and may not be playing a specific role at that time and the hypothetical champ might collect dust for months.
Why would you buy something for someone you don't own? It's like buying a game without owning the system... that's stupid. You cannot use it if you don't have the other thing that goes with it.
I bought Zelda before I bought the Switch because I knew I was gonna get the Switch sooner or later just not at that moment
